data.title: It Was All Good!
data.text: The atmosphere here is casual and nice.  Our server was friendly and helpful.  My wife had a steak and it was done just right.  I had chicken and it was perfect.  We split the molten lava cake and topped it with pumpkin gelato (instead of the usual vanilla bean gelato).   What a treat!  I highly recommend this place.

data.title: My favorite Folsom restaurant
data.text: The food and service is always great.  The best steak they have is the NY strip.  Super tender and flavorful.  This is my "go-to" place whenever I want a great meal or to celebrate a special event.

data.title: Favorable First Impressions
data.text: We recently dined at Sutter House Steakhouse for the first time and were not disappointed in the quality of service or food. Both were exceptional. We were seated at a corner table of the restaurant with nice views looking out to the American River. Our waitress was delightful with a bubbly personality, yet very professional. The selection of wine was impressive. The only suggestion we could make to the manager would be to encourage the hostess at the front podium not to groom in a Gothic style with black lipstick. That was the exception to our positive first impression of a fine restaurant--it simply didn't fit.

data.title: Best food in town
data.text: We had dinner here and sat outside at sunset. The food and service was excellent. We were visiting relatives in Folsom and they recommended this restaurant. It is very nice inside,too.

data.title: Great as always with quality and service.
data.text: I was there for drinks and dinner with 2 of my old friends from out of town. Great bartender, drinks and dinner. Steaks were perfect and only a $18 corkage fee. We love going back to this great restaurant in old town Folsom.

data.title: Excellent dinner
data.text: Excellent dinner and service.  Mole ribeye, and wife got nicks filet.  The filet was slightly better.  Also got bbq prawns and spinach salad.  Stands up to any steakhouse anywhere.  Service and setting were amazing.

data.title: The best steaks in our area
data.text: We recently dined with a large group celebrating a birthday. The server was friendly, efficient and pleasant. Even though there are lots of options on the menu, we can't resist ordering the filet mignon. Perfect every time! Nice selection of side dishes,  wines and desserts. Wish they were open for lunch.

data.title: Anniversary dinner date
data.text: Never fails to exceed my expectations! I tried a house speciality martini and loved it. The service is super and not intrusive. We bring a bottle of wine, and on Sunday's there no corkage fee!

data.title: Are we in Folsom?????
data.text: This is a wonderful steak and fish house.  Once seated for dinner, you feel like you're in San Francisco or some other big city.  Happy hour is great but you have to get there early to get a seat.  Food is wonderful and service is good.   Lots of wine to choose from.  Great for couples celebrating a special event.   Not really good for children.  They open at 4 so don't go for lunch.

data.title: Best happy hour and great steaks!
data.text: Steaks are always perfect. Service is good. Happy house is the best! It's our favorite family dinner place for celebrations.

data.title: Best Steakhouse in Folsom
data.text:
We have dined at FSH several times.  It is the best steakhouse in Folsom and could hold its own with similar restaurants in larger cities.  Mind you, it's not Peter Lugers or Gene & Georgetti, but for the greater Sacramento area it's a cut above the competition.

The menus is diverse, naturally featuring prime aged steaks, but also offering seafood, a pasta or two, and a few nightly specials.  Appetizers and sides are plentiful and well priced.  The wine list is adequate and a fair value.  On our last visit they waived corkage on two bottles that we brought (it may have been because we ordered a third from them).  Desserts are shareable and delicious.

The service is enthusiastic - at times too much so - and the courses were well timed and coordinated.  There was an extremely unruly child seated a couple of tables away and our server politely asked the mother to take him out of the dining room until he could remain under control.  He handled it very professionally and when the woman returned the manager stopped to thank her.  This was a nice touch and averted what could have been a difficult situation.

The ambiance at FSH is warm and friendly.  The dining room is large yet intimate, and the noise level is usually suitable for normal conversation.  The bar is particularly nice.........the bartender was terrific, remaking a drink that one of our party found objectionable.

Reservations are recommended; dress is business casual.  The restaurant is fine for older children but not suited for those under 4-5.  It would be fine for special occasions or simply when you're in the mood for a really good steak.  Enjoy!

data.title: Anniversary Dinner
data.text:
Absolutely fabulous eatery in Folsom
Food was perfectly cooked to order and one of the best steaks in the area.
Decor is awesome.Very old San Francisco decor
Pricing is fairly high for the area but well worth it.
Service is outstanding and not rushed at all

data.title: Excellent dinner
data.text: We had a fantastic dinner here this week. The restaurant is in the Folsom historic district which is charming on its own. The restaurant has a very pleasant atmosphere with high ceilings and lots of wood decor. It has a comfortable elegance about it. It feels like a special place without being stuffy. The service was prompt and friendly. The food was fantastic. I had the spinach salad which had a perfect blend of flavors. I also had the filet mignon which was cooked perfectly. I substituted the sautéed mushrooms for the mashed potatos. An excellent decision. They were the best mushrooms I have ever had. My husband had the chicken breast which was also cooked perfectly. We had a relaxing delicious dinner and will go back again when we are in the area.

data.title: Great atmosphere and food
data.text: We arrived about an hour before closing so sat in the bar which was really comfortable. Our server was very patient with us-6 tired and hungry women who had just played in a tennis tournament! He had great recommendations and was very patient with us.  We have all been to their sister restaurant-5th Street in Chico-so were fairly familiar with the menu.  Our waiter even asked who was the DD since we were all drinking a couple drinks. Loved this restaurant!

data.title: Birthday treat for my carnivore son.
data.text:
We wanted a great steakhouse and had heard some good things about this one. We were not disappointed!
Very nice setting and we enjoyed the deck at sunset overlooking old Folsom and the American River. Service was excellent...Thank you, Alyssa!
Fresh oysters on the half shell were nicely presented and were excellent. I had the ribeye steak--cooked to perfection as was my son's New York steak. Vegetables were perfectly cooked and pared with the meal.
The bar has a good selection of beers, craft cocktails and a very good wine list. Parking can be difficult if you stay on the street--but simply go around to the back and there is a nice large parking lot for the town.
While the place is pricey you do have great service, taste and location. I highly recommend it.

data.title: Excellent Steak and service
data.text: This is the best steak house in Folsom and the general area, you could argue that RC is just as good, but what you have here is a local establishment in a historic site that provides a top quality meal with great service  and ambiance,  Sutter Street Steakhouse has it all. The wine list is pretty good too. If you like steak and take the time to dine here you may have a new favorite place to eat.

data.title: Great steak!
data.text: Always a good experience at his place.  The waiters seem to enjoy serving you and the steaks are always great. Also, good martinis and oysters in the half shell.  It is in a very cool old brick building by the river.

data.title: Very Nice Dinner in Folsom
data.text: We were given a gift card and it was such a pleasure to have eaten there. We had an elegant dinner on a rainy night, with a beautiful view from our table near the wine room. The food was excellent.  A great night.

data.title: Excellent Steakhouse
data.text: Excellent food, service, and ambiance.  A bit pricy but you really get what you pay for.  I definitely prefer this steakhouse over the more expensive yet inferior Morton's or Ruth's Chris.

data.title: NIce place has issues with sun screening for inside diners
data.text: Nice service once we got inside sitting at a patio bar table service was a little slow. Waiters very helpful and knowledgeable
